body.html: Gillard’s speech dispenses with the generally anodyne language employed by Members of the House in a strategy to efface the Leader of the Opposition’s legitimacy in identifying social issues. Members of the House usually promote a show of mutual deference by observing honorific titles when addressing peers, but Gillard frequently and deliberately omits this convention in her speech, altering the mode to despoil the Leader of the Opposition of negative face. (Brown & Levinson, 1978)
